channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Natalie Massenet and Erik Torstensson’s Messy Split, in Dueling Lawsuits
item.description: In the messy, public split of the Net-a-Porter founder Natalie Massenet and Erik Torstensson, no accusations seem off limits.

item.title: An Annual Blast of Pacific Cold Water Did Not Occur, Alarming Scientists
item.description: The cold water upswell, which is vital to marine life, did not materialize for the first time on record. Researchers are trying to figure out why.

item.title: After Charlie Kirk’s Death, Voters Agree Something Is Wrong in US
item.description: In interviews from across the country, people expressed fear and wariness, and said that the country seemed to be spinning out of control.

item.title: Police share video of Charlie Kirk shooting person of interest. And, prices rise
item.description: Police shared photos and a video of a person fleeing from the scene after Charlie Kirk was fatally shot. Plus, inflation is rising, and the job market...

item.title: Something big collapsed this week — again. Do you know what? Take our quiz
item.description: This week, we had news of a drawing that may or may not be the president's, and of a rock that may or may not indicate that Mars had life.

item.title: Insect populations drop even without direct human interference, a new study finds
item.description: Research published this month found that even in pristine, untouched areas, insect populations are still on the decline. Climate change is a likely cu...

item.title: Prince Harry makes surprise visit to Ukraine in support of wounded troops
item.description: Britain's Prince Harry has arrived in Ukraine for a surprise visit in support of wounded service members.

item.title: What MAGA Lost When It Lost Charlie Kirk
item.description: His death makes it harder to look ahead and glimpse what MAGA will stand for.

item.title: Why mothers in the U.S. are scaling back on their work lives
item.description: Workforce participation for moms in the U.S. has been dropping for most of this year, and the reasons are more complicated than return-to-office manda...

item.title: F.B.I. Faces Growing Scrutiny as Kirk Manhunt Continues, and the Fight Over Nonstick Pans
Plane With Detained Hyundai Workers Arrives in South Korea
item.description: The plane carried about 300 South Koreans who had been detained during a large-scale U.S. immigration raid at a battery factory construction site.

item.title: States Want to Ban ‘Forever Chemicals’ in Cookware. These Chefs Say Don’t Do It.
item.description: Rachael Ray and other food celebrities are speaking up in defense of nonstick pans. The actor Mark Ruffalo, who starred in a movie about the risky che...

item.title: Fords, Tank 500s and a New Hospital: The Influence Campaigns in the Pacific
item.description: All around Honiara, the capital of the Solomon Islands and host of a regional summit, are not-so-subtle hints of donor nations competing for hearts an...

item.title: Lawyers for Venezuelans Ask Court to Press D.H.S. on Temporary Protections
item.description: A judge had ordered that Temporary Protected Status be kept in place, but Venezuelans who needed to re-register weren’t able to.

item.title: A Defender of Darkness in the Darkest Place on Earth
item.description: A Chilean astronomer has become dedicated to battling light pollution in the Atacama Desert and preserve what is considered the best place on Earth to...
